intro: Miquelia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine miquel tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Lecythidaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and broad, ovate leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spiny fruits containing edible seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
